answers.answer: Definitely a big baby, but that could slow down. If not, you may just have a big baby which is fine.
Yeah hes big... My baby is exactly he same weight
I am at 7lbs at 34 weeks and my doctor is gonna induce me at 35 or 36 weeks. He doesn't want to do a c section and I have preeclampsia.

I want to get induce before.  I don't want c section eaither and I am really small.  Do you think they can induce me if I ask. ?  I was at the hospital yesterday cause of false contractions but still close not dilating yet.  I really hope I start dialating.  I'm turning 35 weeks on Saturday

My doctor wants to induce mostly because of preeclampsia not necessarily because of the baby's weight. It is always a risk to deliver a month early. I would trust my doctor if I were you. I am very nervous about delivering a month early and the impact that will have on my baby boy.
I was told my baby weighed over 5 pounds at my 33 wk check up.  They didn't seemed concerened and said he is fine.

I was 7lbs at 34 weeks and I am nervous too.  But honestly follow what your doctors says. Voice your concerns and make them listen. My doctor and I are very close. I have a significant amount of stress and medical issues that are concerning him which is why he wants to induce so early. My job has me on my feet 60 hours a week and is giving me a hell of a time about sitting down or cutting back my hours, you would think I am the only person who can do my job. I can't afford to lose my job but at the same time my swelling is getting out of control and my blood pressure is skyrocketing.Be patient 5lbs at 33weeks is not that big it is a little big but manageable. The longer the baby stays in the oven the better for the baby.
Thank you lady I'm just a little scare and concer. First time mommy here and.  I'm 18 years old.
Awe I am a FTM too but I am 35. It will be fine I promise! Our bodies are made for this!
Lol I had my son at 38 weeks and he weighed 9 pounds 5 Oz. Feel lucky
The ultrasounds aren't completely accurate. It's more of a guess as to what the baby will weigh, if I'm understanding other posts correctly

Why won't my OB Dr tell me how big my baby is? She's only done 1 US which I'm ok with but is having multiple US the only way she can tell me how big he is? She only guesstimates or tells me "yes he measuring 33 weeks".

My OB didn't judge from an US at all. After he measured me he felt my belly and found the babies head. He ran his hands up and found my babies bum and said he is 7lbs. But my doc is one of the best it took me a month to pick him out, they call him the baby maker because his specialty is fertility.  He personally  calls me every week to check on me and I can call him anytime.
CharnaMarie you certainly have an exceptional OB doctor and I very much envy you.

Charna Marie. I envy you too how lucky. I just met my doctor today. Thru all my pregnancy a nurse has check me. Last visit I asked Her she Was gonna deliver me since  she's the only one that has check me and she said no.  She said she's  wasn't a doctor. So I told her. I'm gonna feel so weird and awkward  showing myself to someone I have never met so they give me an appointment today and I met the doctor theh did  a test Fkr infection  forgot the name lol. But thry were supposed to start checking if I have dilated  and she didn't she didn't even ask me anything did the test and left didn't like her.  I wonder if I can change doctors this late on my pregnancy.
Wanttobeamommy1 - I thinks it's too late for us to change doctor's but I have to admit that I'm tempted. Lol

question: I am 34 weeks and my baby weights  6 pounds already.  Isn't that to much.   ?
title: big baby.
